00001 /**********************************************************************
00002 * $Id$          pwm_dual_edge.c                                 2010-05-21
00003 */
00026 #include "lpc17xx_pwm.h"
00027 #include "lpc17xx_libcfg.h"
00028 #include "lpc17xx_pinsel.h"
00029 
00030 /* Example group ----------------------------------------------------------- */
00036 /*-------------------------MAIN FUNCTION------------------------------*/
00037 /*********************************************************************/
00042 int c_entry(void)
00043 {
00044         uint8_t temp;
00045         PWM_TIMERCFG_Type PWMCfgDat;
00046         PWM_MATCHCFG_Type PWMMatchCfgDat;
00047         PINSEL_CFG_Type PinCfg;
00048 
00049         /* PWM block section -------------------------------------------- */
00050         /* Initialize PWM peripheral, timer mode
00051          * PWM prescale value = 1 (absolute value - tick value) */
00052         PWMCfgDat.PrescaleOption = PWM_TIMER_PRESCALE_TICKVAL;
00053         PWMCfgDat.PrescaleValue = 1;
00054         PWM_Init(LPC_PWM1, PWM_MODE_TIMER, (void *) &PWMCfgDat);
00055 
00056         /*
00057          * Initialize PWM pin connect
00058          *
00059          */
00060         PinCfg.Funcnum = 1;
00061         PinCfg.OpenDrain = 0;
00062         PinCfg.Pinmode = 0;
00063         PinCfg.Portnum = 2;
00064         for (temp = 0; temp <= 6; temp++){
00065                 PinCfg.Pinnum = temp;
00066                 PINSEL_ConfigPin(&PinCfg);
00067         }
00068 
00069 
00070         /* Set match value for PWM match channel 0 = 100, update immediately */
00071         PWM_MatchUpdate(LPC_PWM1, 0, 100, PWM_MATCH_UPDATE_NOW);
00072         /* PWM Timer/Counter will be reset when channel 0 matching
00073          * no interrupt when match
00074          * no stop when match */
00075         PWMMatchCfgDat.IntOnMatch = DISABLE;
00076         PWMMatchCfgDat.MatchChannel = 0;
00077         PWMMatchCfgDat.ResetOnMatch = ENABLE;
00078         PWMMatchCfgDat.StopOnMatch = DISABLE;
00079         PWM_ConfigMatch(LPC_PWM1, &PWMMatchCfgDat);
00080 
00081         /* Configure each PWM channel: --------------------------------------------- */
00082         /* - Channel 2: Double Edge
00083          * - Channel 4: Double Edge
00084          * - Channel 5: Single Edge
00085          * The Match register values are as follows:
00086          * - MR0 = 100 (PWM rate)
00087          * - MR1 = 41, MR2 = 78 (PWM2 output)
00088          * - MR3 = 53, MR4 = 27 (PWM4 output)
00089          * - MR5 = 65 (PWM5 output)
00090          * PWM Duty on each PWM channel:
00091          * - Channel 2: Set by match 1, Reset by match 2.
00092          * - Channel 4: Set by match 3, Reset by match 4.
00093          * - Channel 5: Set by match 0, Reset by match 5.
00094          */
00095 
00096         /* Edge setting ------------------------------------ */
00097         PWM_ChannelConfig(LPC_PWM1, 2, PWM_CHANNEL_DUAL_EDGE);
00098         PWM_ChannelConfig(LPC_PWM1, 4, PWM_CHANNEL_DUAL_EDGE);
00099         PWM_ChannelConfig(LPC_PWM1, 5, PWM_CHANNEL_SINGLE_EDGE);
00100 
00101         /* Match value setting ------------------------------------ */
00102         PWM_MatchUpdate(LPC_PWM1, 1, 41, PWM_MATCH_UPDATE_NOW);
00103         PWM_MatchUpdate(LPC_PWM1, 2, 78, PWM_MATCH_UPDATE_NOW);
00104         PWM_MatchUpdate(LPC_PWM1, 3, 53, PWM_MATCH_UPDATE_NOW);
00105         PWM_MatchUpdate(LPC_PWM1, 4, 27, PWM_MATCH_UPDATE_NOW);
00106         PWM_MatchUpdate(LPC_PWM1, 5, 65, PWM_MATCH_UPDATE_NOW);
00107 
00108 
00109         /* Match option setting ------------------------------------ */
00110         for (temp = 1; temp < 6; temp++)
00111         {
00112                 /* Configure match option */
00113                 PWMMatchCfgDat.IntOnMatch = DISABLE;
00114                 PWMMatchCfgDat.MatchChannel = temp;
00115                 PWMMatchCfgDat.ResetOnMatch = DISABLE;
00116                 PWMMatchCfgDat.StopOnMatch = DISABLE;
00117                 PWM_ConfigMatch(LPC_PWM1, &PWMMatchCfgDat);
00118         }
00119 
00120         /* Enable PWM Channel Output ------------------------------------ */
00121         /* Channel 2 */
00122         PWM_ChannelCmd(LPC_PWM1, 2, ENABLE);
00123         /* Channel 4 */
00124         PWM_ChannelCmd(LPC_PWM1, 4, ENABLE);
00125         /* Channel 5 */
00126         PWM_ChannelCmd(LPC_PWM1, 5, ENABLE);
00127 
00128         /* Reset and Start counter */
00129         PWM_ResetCounter(LPC_PWM1);
00130         PWM_CounterCmd(LPC_PWM1, ENABLE);
00131 
00132         /* Start PWM now */
00133         PWM_Cmd(LPC_PWM1, ENABLE);
00134 
00135     /* Loop forever */
00136     while(1);
00137     return 1;
00138 }
00139 
00140 /* With ARM and GHS toolsets, the entry point is main() - this will
00141    allow the linker to generate wrapper code to setup stacks, allocate
00142    heap area, and initialize and copy code and data segments. For GNU
00143    toolsets, the entry point is through __start() in the crt0_gnu.asm
00144    file, and that startup code will setup stacks and data */
00145 int main(void)
00146 {
00147     return c_entry();
00148 }

00151 #ifdef  DEBUG

00153 * @brief                Reports the name of the source file and the source line number
00154 *                               where the CHECK_PARAM error has occurred.
00155 * @param[in]    file Pointer to the source file name
00156 * @param[in]    line assert_param error line source number
00157 * @return               None
00158 *******************************************************************************/
00159 void check_failed(uint8_t *file, uint32_t line)
00160 {
00161         /* User can add his own implementation to report the file name and line number,
00162          ex: printf("Wrong parameters value: file %s on line %d\r\n", file, line) */
00163 
00164         /* Infinite loop */
00165         while(1);
00166 }
